intro: Arthrophytum lehmannianum, commonly known as the Lehmann's stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, fleshy leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white during the summer months. It is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils, where it forms dense, low-growing clumps. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appearance, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in xeriscapes.
